meanings.definition: A staining technique used in microscopy to colorize certain structures or cells that have been previously stained with a different color.
meanings.sent1: During the lab experiment, the scientist performed counterstaining to highlight the cell structures.
meanings.sent2: The biologist used counterstaining to make the cell nuclei more visible under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The counterstaining process turned the cells into a colorful artwork on the slide.
meanings.sent4: Adding the second stain was like giving the cells a vibrant makeover through counterstaining.
meanings.sent5: The vivid colors from counterstaining made the microscopic world come alive.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a second stain to a specimen in order to enhance contrast and visibility.
meanings.sent1: After the initial staining, the technician proceeded with counterstaining to improve the image clarity.
meanings.sent2: Counterstaining is crucial in microscopy to make the specimen details stand out.
meanings.sent3: The counterstaining step made the specimen look like a tiny rainbow under the lens.
meanings.sent4: The second stain acted like a spotlight, thanks to counterstaining, revealing hidden features.
meanings.sent5: The contrast achieved through counterstaining was like turning up the brightness on a dim picture.
